column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Like every other New York-born-Italian
column2: I'd rather carve my own eyeball out than admit that Chicago-style pizza actually deserves recognition
column3: let alone praise. It certainly didn't help matters that the only time I had ever tried it was at a Pizzeria Uno in a lonely Miami strip mall. Â That experience basically reinforced the notion that Chicago had no idea what they were doing when it came to pizza.
